description: Probably originally college or showbusiness slang in the United States, then popularized in the American fashion magazine Harperâ€™s Bazaar in the 1930s: see quotation.

entries.meaning: Flair, vitality, or zest; energy; vigor. [from 1930s]
examples: The show had a lot of pizzazz, with glittering costumes and upbeat music.
